items.title: Heracles neemt enorm risico met verkoop Hornkamp
items.summary: Heracles Almelo gaat Jizz Hornkamp kwijtraken. De 27-jarige spits gaat zijn carri√®re vervolgen bij AZ en laat daarmee een enorme leegte achter in het Asito Stadion. Heracles is als nummer zeventien van de Eredivisie de winterstop in gegaan en moet het in de tweede seizoenshelft stellen zonder de clubtopscorer. Over de risico's van de verkoop van Hornkamp.

We are the business end of A Place in the Sun on 4Seven before the football starts. Will they make an offer on a property? The tension is palpable!. Continue reading...

items.title: Scott departs Hibs to replace Sadiku at Celtic Women
items.summary: Celtic have appointed Grant Scott as the club's new Women's head coach.

items.title: Precheur gone - so what's next for London City?
items.summary: When London City Lionesses sacked manager Jocelyn Precheur it sparked controversy - but they are a club who have always done things differently.

items.title: Slory bij Go Ahead herenigd met Boel: 'Belangrijke reden om te komen'
items.summary: Go Ahead Eagles heeft de tijdelijk komst van Jaden Slory maandag bevestigd. De twintigjarige aanvaller speelt voor de rest van het seizoen op huurbasis in Deventer. Go Ahead heeft zo met enige vertraging beet op de transfermarkt.

items.title: Sky Sports extends PGA Tour deal until 2029
items.summary: Sky and the PGA Tour have agreed a four-year extension to their long-standing partnership in the UK and Ireland through to the end of 2029.

items.title: 'Milan bereikt akkoord met West Ham over concurrent voor Gim√©nez'
items.summary: Santiago Gimenez lijkt er een concurrent bij te gaan krijgen in de komende transferwindow bij AC Milan. De Mexicaan kampt met blessures en voldoet niet aan de verwachtingen, waardoor er volgens meerdere bronnen al een akkoord zou zijn gesloten met zijn opvolger.

items.title: Leverkusen level up as Hjulmand oversees rebuild after Ten Hag debacle
items.summary: A fightback win over RB Leipzig before the Christmas break is just reward for coach who faced a thankless task Leipzig might not be every Bundesliga fan‚Äôs idea of a weekend idyll but as the sun set on 2025, the venue for the final Saturday night Topspiel of the year might have been the scene of a minor Christmas miracle. It had already been a worthy showpiece to draw the curtains on pre-Christmas Bundesliga but the end result ‚Äì achieved not without a smidgeon of controversy ‚Äì left us with a satisfying tale to tell by an open fire over holiday season. For Bayer Leverkusen can enjoy their brief break with a rosy glow of satisfaction with their win against a direct competitor a clear measure of how far they have come; or, if you like, a measure of how far Kasper Hjulmand has taken them. Leverkusen sit third over the bridge to the new year which, if we were to return to the closure of the summer transfer window, looked a long way off. Continue reading...

items.title: Glasner hopes to gee up jaded Palace as he eyes Carabao Cup revenge over Arsenal
items.summary: Tuesday‚Äôs quarter-final will be the Eagles‚Äô 29th game of the season and Gabriel Jesus is set to line up against them Oliver Glasner could be forgiven for preferring to enjoy a rest with his family in Austria a few days before Christmas rather than preparing for Crystal Palace‚Äôs 29th game of the season ‚Äì a Carabao Cup quarter-final against Arsenal on Tuesday night. However, any suggestion that Palace may have to prioritise given they remain in four competitions was unsurprisingly dismissed. ‚ÄúNo, I don‚Äôt think so,‚Äù said Glasner after his team‚Äôs 4-1 hammering by Leeds on Saturday. ‚ÄúIf somebody tells me that we lose on purpose, the next day I‚Äôm not the manager any more.‚Äù Continue reading...

items.title: Peter Bosz als bondscoach? 'Geen garantie op direct droomvoetbal'
items.summary: Er is een lobby gaande voor Peter Bosz als bondscoach. In Rondje Eredivisie bespreken Martijn Krabbendam, Geert-Jan Jakobs en Inta Janssen wie na het WK de nieuwe bondscoach moet worden. Kan de huidige PSV-trainer het droomvoetbal bij Oranje brengen waar iedereen zo naar verlangt?

items.title: Dalot: Fernandes injury 'massive' blow to Utd
items.summary: Diogo Dalot called Bruno Fernandes' injury a "massive" blow as Manchester United wait to find out the severity of the skipper's setback.

items.title: Kane smashes Arjen Robben record in Bayern rout
items.summary: Harry Kane scored his 30th club goal of the season as Bayern Munich shrugged off an injury and illness crisis to sweep past Heidenheim 4-0 on Sunday and go into the Bundesliga's winter break with a nine-point lead.

items.title: Arteta: Jesus could start in cup against Palace
items.summary: Mikel Arteta hinted he was ready to hand Gabriel Jesus his first start in 345 days in Arsenal's Carabao Cup quarterfinal clash against Crystal Palace.

items.title: Man United's Mazaroui 'fantastic' in Hakimi role
items.summary: Achraf Hakimi was unable to make his comeback from injury in Morocco's opener at the Africa Cup of Nations on Sunday -- a 2-0 victory over Comoros -- but head coach Walid Regragui said his replacement is just as strong an option.

items.title: Transfers Feyenoord: 'Brentford kijkt opnieuw in Rotterdam rond'
items.summary: Ook buiten de transferperiode om volgt VI het transfernieuws bij Feyenoord op de voet, ook omdat het sneller dan je denkt alweer januari is. De doelwitten van de Rotterdammers, duiding van de clubwatcher, of aandacht in buitenlandse media. We verzamelen alles hier.

items.title: Liverpool win again, but lose Isak to injury. Now what? Plus: Bar√ßa ride their luck, more
items.summary: Liverpool won a third straight game, but Alexander Isak's injury and some familiar issues mean the Reds still have a lot of work to do.

items.title: England name squad for away series against South Africa
items.summary: The Vitality Roses have named their squad for their three-match test series away to South Africa in January.

items.title: Villarreal tried everything against Barcelona ‚Äì except moving the game to Miami | Sid Lowe
items.summary: In a match mercifully on Spanish soil, Villarreal bombarded Bar√ßa but were undone by profligacy and ill-discipline Marcelino Garc√≠a Toral came bounding down the steps like an excited schoolboy when the bell goes. He flew past the substitutes and staff, skidded left, and sprinted up the line all wide-eyed and excited, shaking his fists and beaming. He had gone 15 or 20 metres, maybe 25 when he realised ‚Äì just a fraction later than everyone else ‚Äì that something had gone wrong again. So Villarreal‚Äôs manager put the brakes on and his head down, and turned back towards the bench feeling almost as silly as this was getting. This, he already suspected, was going to be one of those days. They had been playing 16 minutes and the goal Villarreal had scored, the goal Jules Kound√© scored for them, wasn‚Äôt a goal at all. Just as the chance they made after 80 seconds wasn‚Äôt, Nicolas P√©p√© putting wide from a yard out. Just as Ayoze P√©rez‚Äôs opportunity on six minutes wasn‚Äôt a goal, Tajon Buchanan‚Äôs effort on 13 wasn‚Äôt, and Raphinha‚Äôs on nine minutes was. One moment ‚Äì a dash, a tumble and a penalty ‚Äì and from nowhere Villarreal trailed Barcelona. Now they were level again only for a raised flag to halt the manager‚Äôs run as suddenly, the oh neatly summing up the afternoon when La Liga‚Äôs best teams met on the Mediterranean, not in Miami, and Barcelona beat Villarreal 2-0. Continue reading...

items.title: McCullum concedes England future 'up to other people' after 11-day Ashes series defeat
items.summary: Brendon McCullum is eager to stay on as England's head coach but admits his future is "up to other people" after losing the Ashes in just 11 days.

items.title: Should Van de Ven have been sent off for Isak tackle?
items.summary: Micky van de Ven faced no action for the challenge which led to Alexander Isak's injury in Liverpool's win at Tottenham - but did the officials make the right call?
